description: Information required about your experiments to trigger the creation of a metadata spreadsheet.
name: template-questionnaire

identifyingOrganisms.user_friendly: What species are the donors of your experiment?
identifyingOrganisms.guidelines: This adds relevant species specific fields to the donor tab of the spreadsheet.

preNatalQuantity.user_friendly: Are any of your donor samples pre-natal?
preNatalQuantity.guidelines: If some donors are prenatal we add fields for capturing gestational age, if all are prenatal we remove fields for capturing organism age.

donorsRelated.user_friendly: Are any of your donors related to one another?
donorsRelated.guidelines: Adds fields for capturing familial relationships, not required if none of your donors are human.

specimenType.user_friendly: What type of specimens did you use?
specimenType.guidelines: Expands the available protocols you can can include in your experimental definition

specimenPurchased.guidelines: Add fields for capturing purchase information. Not required if all specimens are Primary Tissue

experimentInfo.user_friendly: Do you wish to record the provenance of the experimental process?
experimentInfo.guidelines: This will add fields for capturing where, when and who performed your experiment.

experimentTimecourse.user_friendly: Did your experiment involve a timecourse?
experimentTimecourse.guidelines: This will add fields for capturing cell suspension timecourse details.

protocols.user_friendly: Which of the following protocols did you use?
protocols.guidelines: This will add fields for capturing the relevant details of the experimental process.

technologyType.user_friendly: What type of technology did you use?
technologyType.guidelines: This will add fields for capturing the relevant imaging or sequencing protocol.

title: Spreadsheet Questionnaire
